title: Kunde 2015 Block 4SB20 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)
description: Split pea and earthy mushroom give way to sparkling acidity and a bright, flush taste of lemon and grapefruit in this succulent white, low in oak imprint. This is a food-friendly wine that can stand on its own, complex and layered with a citrus-squeezed finish.

title: La Chablisienne 2014 Les Vénérables  (Chablis)
description: Bringing together old vines from a number of the Chablisienne cooperative's vineyards, this wine is concentrated and finely structured. Its rich creamed apple and tangy orange zest flavors are lit by acidity and a mineral edge. Drink from 2018.

title: Labouré-Roi 2015 Clos Rousseau Premier Cru  (Santenay)
description: From the village at the southern end of the Côte de Beaune, this wine is warm and ripe, with great berry flavors and a good sense of structure from tannins and wood aging. It's packed with fruit and likely to age well. Drink from 2021.

title: Tonnino 2014 Grillo (Terre Siciliane)
description: Lovely scents of white spring flower, white stone fruit and citrus set the tone on this vibrant savory white. On the mineral-driven palate, notes of saline and Mediterranean herb accent grapefruit, lemon and white peach. It finishes crisp and clean.

title: Sanglier Cellars 2014 River Tusque Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
description: Smoky and seductive in black cherry and a healthy dose of Asian spice, this wine is full-bodied and well concentrated in a thicket of blueberry and gamy meat.

title: Yalumba 2015 Made With Organic Grapes Shiraz (South Australia)
description: Yalumba has been pushing the organic envelope in recent years, and this Shiraz is a winner. It's full bodied and supple nearly to the point of creaminess, but delivers mixed berry, vanilla and baking-spice flavors, all with a certain amount of elegance. Drink now–2022.

title: Z'IVO 2012 Pinot Blanc (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: This late release offers a good look at how the better Oregon white wines can improve with a few additional years in the bottle. Smooth and rich, it mixes pineapple, Asian pear and honeysuckle scents and flavors. Good verve and a light, pleasant hint of fresh herb.

title: Vazart Coquart & Fils NV Blanc de Blancs Réserve Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: Close to Epernay and on the cusp of the Chardonnay-dominated Côte des Blancs, this producer has Grand Cru holdings in the village of Chouilly. Those vines have produced a wine that balances mineral-laced fruit with a soft aftertaste. Young and with apple flavors, it's great now but will continue to develop in the cellar. Drink from 2018.

title: Vignerons des Terres Secrètes 2013 Les Cras  (Saint-Véran)
description: Now perfectly ready to drink, this wine from vines close to Pouilly-Fuissé is ripe with yellow fruit, juicy acidity and a smooth texture. It has plenty of minerality to keep it bright and lively. Drink now.

title: 29 & Oak Wines 2013 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: Half Cabernet Sauvignon, and a quarter each of Cabernet Franc and Merlot, this wine is a smoky blend that's gamy and feral, while also pretty on the nose in violet and bramble. Red currant and red cherry fill out the midpalate with tart fruit.

title: Adega Algueira 2015 Brandan Godello (Ribeira Sacra)
description: Peach and nectarine aromas come with a dusty covering. This Godello feels both round and pulpy but also balanced and well cut by acidity. Dry almost briny white-fruit flavors are stony and suggest nectarine on the finish. Drink now.

title: Baldassari Family Wines 2014 Nolan Vineyard Syrah (Bennett Valley)
description: Velvety and dense, this vineyard designate from a cool appellation is floral and herbal as well as freshly celebratory in wild strawberry. A leathery texture finds balance and life in prickly acidity.

title: Ballentine 2014 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: Rich and thick, this full-bodied, ripely bold wine has small amounts of Petite Sirah, Petit Verdot, Syrah, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Mocha chocolate meets blackberry jam washed down in fresh-brewed coffee, making for a memorable experience.

title: Deutz NV Brut Classic  (Champagne)
description: This nonvintage classic is on point with its soft, ripe style. It has just enough maturity to fill out the fruit, with hints of almond and toast. On the palate, attractive bright citrus and green apple flavors dominate.

title: Baron-Fuenté NV Esprit Rosé de Saignée  (Champagne)
description: Darker in color than many rosés, this Champagne was produced using color from the grape skins rather than by adding still red wine. That method yields a wine with more structure, faint tannins and a noticeable toasty character. Its red fruit is vivid and rich, the wine ready to drink.

title: Beaulieu Vineyard 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Smoky and soft, this full-bodied, rounded wine tastes of baked raspberry and vanilla, its texture velvety and likably smooth. Concentrated, it retains only moderate acidity, peaking in freshness on the finish.

title: Boude Baudin NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: Dominated by the red grapes Pinot Noir and Pinot Meunier, this is a structured Champagne with ripe layers of red fruit. It falls on the dry side of Brut, with plenty of crisp acidity. A hint of tannic structure emerges on the finish—compliments of the red wine added for color.

title: Brander 2015 Bouchet Red (Los Olivos District)
description: Black cherry pie, milk chocolate and lilacs combine for a very accessible and rather lavish nose on this blend of 65% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Cabernet Franc and 10% Merlot. It's easy to like on the sip, with candied purple fruit and licorice spice flavors, proving very fruity, lush and quaffable.

title: Brander 2015 Tierra Alta Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Ballard Canyon)
description: Grass, wet concrete, bitter orange rinds, wet hay and rosemary elements show on the nose of this single vineyard bottling. There is a firm, cement-like texture to the sip, much like licking rocks, with fresh lime peel flavors. It retains freshness days after opening.

title: Sojourn 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: From several vineyard sites, this lot selection is tropical and rich on the nose, as well as honeyed and thick on the palate, showing its youthful vigor and the density of the vintage. Fig and papaya meet orange and lemon before a toasted note of coconut oak rises on the finish.

title: Spann Vineyards 2012 Mayacamas Range Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This combines 79% of the variety with 14% Cabernet Franc and 7% Petit Verdot. Together they offer crisp red fruit and a hearty sense of the forest, an aroma of pine persistent and lingering. Silky, with good acidity, it showers the finish in an oaky grip.

title: Neyers 2015 Placida Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Dense in tannin and yet bristling in acidity, this youthful wine is still looking for its ultimate identity. Still, it works, as a complex, adolescent combination of cinnamon, clove, cola and dried herb.

title: J. Christopher 2014 Nuages Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: This cuvée is principally from the estate (Appassionata) vineyard. Lush, spicy and spread broadly across the palate, it pleases with strawberry-raspberry fruit, milk chocolate and a dusting of cocoa powder. The wine does seem to lighten up rather quickly at the finish, but further bottle age may fix that.

title: Joleté 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Winemaker Tom Mortimer also produces the outstanding Aubichon wines; this is his own label, and it offers exceptional value. It's stylish, modern and elegant, with precisely-defined raspberry fruit accented with sweet ripe tomato. The wine has a crisp sculpted mouthfeel, and just the slightest suggestion of barrel toast framing the finish.

title: Kenefick Ranch 2013 Caitlin's Select Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Calistoga)
description: Blended with 14% Petit Verdot, this is a thickly concentrated and ripe wine, generous in bacon meat, tobacco, mocha and blackberry pie. Creamy in texture, it is a robust version of the variety.

title: Kenefick Ranch 2013 Chris's Cuvée Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)
description: Currant, cranberry and blueberry pop from the glass in this burly, brawny and full-bodied wine from the warm reaches of Calistoga. Soft, rounded tannins wrap themselves seamlessly around the juicy fruit and ample vanilla spice.

title: Kenwood 2015 Six Ridges Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: A bright, fluffy white, this moderately bodied, oaked wine is intertwined in apple, pear and a bite of nutmeg, with supportive acidity and a soft, smooth texture.

title: Kilikanoon 2015 Mort's Block Riesling (Clare Valley)
description: Lime sherbet and wet-stone aromas are classic for the variety and region. This is a light- to medium-bodied wine, dry, with high acidity that drives it through a long, zesty finish. Drink it now with raw oysters or ceviche, or cellar it another five years to develop greater weight and complexity.

title: Michael David 2014 6th Sense Syrah (Lodi)
description: Big but well poised and supple, this luxuriously ripe-tasting, mouthfilling, semisweet wine has enormous fruit flavors of black cherry and black currant wrapped in velvety, fine-grained tannins. It's so smooth that it's firm structure is not readily apparent.

title: Louis M. Martini 2014 Monte Rosso Vineyard Gnarly Vine Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: Fully ripe, extracted fruit dominates in this robust, heady wine, a mixture of red berry jam and vanilla that takes on a perceptible sweetness on the palate. From the mighty mountain vineyard, it also shows dustings of dried herb and brush, an herbal undertone that balances its overall intensity.
